text: Is any of this gonna find its way into Base? It's so neat

elements.text: Is any of this gonna find its way into Base? It's so neat
Thank you.

text:
> Is any of this gonna find its way into Base?
Some of these ideas were nascient around when v0.7/v1.0 was developed, but the idea of iterating values didn't make it over the line. Unfortunately without that, a lot of the other parts don't really fit together well.

An ordered dictionary could be added to `Base` at any stage, as could some cleanups to `AbstractDict`  and perhaps even a public token interface for `Dict` / `AbstractDict`. Having dictionaries share tokens and have fast co-iteration may also be possible (but co-iterating `Pair`s is a bit of a bummer, and aliasing guarantees may change...). But as always, any truly breaking changes would need to wait for Julia 2.0, and is up to the community and Julia developers as a whole.

text:
> Also comes with great documentations
It's funny - I always feel a "pressure" to use Documenter.jl or similar, rather than a long README and high docstring coverage as done in Dictionaries.jl. I'm not really sure what the ideal solution is - what do other people think?

text: I'm fine with a good README and docstrings but I may be biased since I tend to do that myself. Or the even more unorthodox <https://github.com/GunnarFarneback/Multibreak.jl/blob/master/test/tutorial.jl>

elements.text: I'm fine with a good README and docstrings but I may be biased since I tend to do that myself. Or the even more unorthodox

text: What I find nice with Documenter is that it is easier to test docstrings and snippets and compartmentalize the documentation. And cross-references are neat too.
